comments:
After moving to the latest integration build I-I20050408-200504082033 I am
unable to build any web or utility project properly.

After updating the builders names to ComponentStructuralBuilder and
ComponentStructuralBuilderDependencyResolver as required I still get a
NullPointerException in the log when trying to build and files are not copied to
the .deployable directory.

The same happens on a clean workspace with the sample projects at
http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/jst/components/j2ee/scenarios/resource/WebSample.zip
(again, after renaming builders).


This is the full log, the error is written at each build:

Thanks for the report. I'm just re-assigning to Michael for comment/assessment.

This NPE here would be if your project does not have IProjectProperties.  Is
tehre anyway I can get a copy of your workspace to attempt to recreate in dev?
Thanks

I've continue to look into this, does your Project have a .runtime file, and if
so does is it populated w/ any meta information.  Thanks for the info....
Derek

You can reproduce the bug easily using the old (M3) examples from:
http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/jst/components/j2ee/scenarios/MavenEclipseIntegration.html
just downloading
http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/jst/components/j2ee/scenarios/resource/WebSample.zip


After downloading the zip I only changed:
- .project replacing the new
org.eclipse.wst.common.modulecore.ComponentStructuralBuilder and
org.eclipse.wst.common.modulecore.ComponentStructuralBuilderDependencyResolver
- .wtpmodules adding the new module-type element (for csrweb: <module-type
module-type-id="jst.web"><version>2.4</version><property name="context-root"
value="csrweb"/></module-type>)

Start eclipse in a new workspace, import the projects and try a clean build, you
will still get the errors in the latest (14/4) Integration and nightly builds.

Is there anything else changed in the descriptors from M3? A dtd/xsd will be a
nice to have, along with some updated documentation (any plan to update the
wtp/maven integration doc?).

btw, it happens both on the sample projects without a .runtime file ant on other
projects working with M3 with a .runtime.

the .runtime, working with wptM3, contains:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<runtime runtime-id="Tomcat 5.5" server-id="24_03_05_15.325" servers="false"/>

The problem is w/ the .runtime file, this must have changed via the server folks
from m3 to m4.  Newly created .runtimes simply contain

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<runtime runtime-id="J2EE Runtime Library" servers="false"/>
Notice yours had a "server-id".  I have not seen any notes concerning a
migration story here, but i'm willing to be you can edit the xml by hand or
simply remove your target and re-add it.  In terms of the npe your seeing this
is thrown because the builder can not resolve your target, this is a requirement
for all flexible projects so while i think the builder should fail a little more
nicely its still going to fail, as the individual component builders are
registered via a runtime to allow for extended builders for new runtimes.
If you can give the above a try we can then close this defect and simply not the
migration issue.
Thanks
Derek

> Newly created .runtimes simply contain
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<runtime runtime-id="J2EE Runtime Library" servers="false"/>

the "server-id" gets added automatically when you first run the project on a
server, this also happens with M4 and it has not changes.

IHMO the NPE should not be related to the .runtime configuration, it seems to
happen when wtp tries to understand the module type.

The problem also happens with project created directly with the latest I build,
the following stack trace is generated after creating a new web project/module
and a new flexible project:

also if I get the NPE in the log.

This no longer seems to be a possible builder issue, stack trace you are 
seeing is from the working sets in the common navigator.  I will reassign to 
the developer working on this code.  (note I am unable to reproduce on the 
4.15 integration build....on a right click 'run on server' the server dialog 
launches just fine.

I could not reproduce the bug. Please pick up the latest driver tonite and
verify it.

Thanks
verified with the latest I build: the NPE no longer occurs, thanks
Changed Version field given new release numbering.
